Read templates and data files into a list structure as an alternative input to `EMLassemblyline` functions

Source: R/read_files.R
read_files.Rd

Use this function to read metadata templates and data into an R list object for input to `EMLassemblyline` functions, rather than supplying the files themselves.

This function is primarily used for testing and demonstration purposes however, this approach is generally useful for inputing metadata and data from a meta- or data-base and other upstream sources. See below for list object structure.

read_files(path, data.path = path, data.table = NULL,
other.entity = NULL, sep = NULL)

Arguments

path

(character) Path to metadata templates.
data.path

(character) Path to data tables and other entities.
data.table

(character) Data table name(s). If more than one, then supply as a vector of character strings (e.g. `data.table = c("concentrations.csv", "characteristics.csv")`).
other.entity

(character) Name(s) of `other.entity`(s) in this dataset. Use `other.entity` for all non-`data.table` files. `other.entity`(s) should be stored at `data.path`.
sep

(character) Delimiter of `data.table`. Use this argument if `read_files` fails to automatically identify `data.table` field delimiters.

Value

(named list) Named list with this internal structure (NOTE: use `NA` for non-existant content):

  • `template` Metadata template files

    • `abstract.txt` Abstract template

      • `content` EML::TextType containing abstract

      • `path` Path to file

    • `additional_info.txt` Additional information template

      • `content` EML::TextType containing additional info

      • `path` Path to file

    • `attributes_*.txt` Attributes template where * is name of `data.table` described by the attributes

      • `content` Data frame of attributes template

      • `path` Path to file

    • `bounding_boxes.txt` Bounding boxes template

      • `content` Data frame of bounding boxes template

      • `path` Path to file

    • `catvars_*.txt` Categorical variables template where * is name of `data.table` described by the catvars

      • `content` Data frame of categorical variables template

      • `path` Path to file

    • `custom_units.txt` Custom units template

      • `content` Data frame of custom units template

      • `path` Path to file

    • `geographic_coverage.txt` Geographic coverage template

      • `content` Data frame of geographic coverage template

      • `path` Path to file

    • `intellectual_rights.txt` Intellectual rights template

      • `content` EML::TextType containing intellectual rights

      • `path` Path to file

    • `keywords.txt` Keywords template

      • `content` Data frame of keywords template

      • `path` Path to file

    • `methods.txt` Methods template

      • `content` EML::Methods containing methods

      • `path` Path to file

    • `personnel.txt` Personnel template

      • `content` Data frame of personnel template

      • `path` Path to file

    • `taxonomicCoverage.xml` Taxonomic coverage EML element

      • `content` EML::taxonomicCoverage

      • `path` Path to file

  • `data.table`

    • `data.table.name.ext` Name of data table including file extension

      • `content` Data frame of data table

      • `path` Path to data table (required)

  • `other.entity`

    • `other.entity.name.ext` Name of other entity including file extension

      • `content` Set to `NA`

      • `path` Path to other entity (required)

Note

Paths to data tables and other entities must be present for auto-generated metadata content.

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
  • Note
